The new catalogue no longer gives the reading level, AR level, etc. My parents and I both used this information. Please make it available again.

Additional Comments: no

What could we improve: I want to pick my own due date! I don't like the orders being submitted for me.
Additional Comments: Please let us pick our own due dates again! I miss having multiple flyers as well. I miss 1 dollar book choices too.

What could we improve: I do not like that you send letters to my classroom parents and sign my name to it. I prefer not disclosing parent emails however,  I cannot offer books from Scholastic without entering email addresses. It is one thing to send a little reminder it is another thing to send letters that pressure people to purchase. Letters being sent with my name should have my editing before being sent.

Additional Comments: Yes.  I did not even know that my students' parents had placed orders.  Since I am no longer in the loop, it would be helpful to get at least email information that someone had ordered that way I know to expect it, and make sure it is all correct.  It was a bit of a shock. Plus, I wont know or be able to help if an order is wrong.  Having said that, it is nice to just be able to set up an account and alllow parents to go in there and shop for what they would like.
I absolutely love Scholastic Book Club for my classroom and students!  Thank you for always being amazing! :)
Absolutely love the new way of placing orders for teachers.
I wish I could still put my teacher code on back of catalogs for parents to use for online ordering. Emailing them the link has decreased my ordering.

What could we improve: I do not like that there are no order forms on the book order form that goes home with the students. I have many students whose parents don’t do the online ordering and it’s so not helpful for me to have to figure it out when they bring me in the money. I really like how it was done before with the order form. It was much more straightforward. This is super frustrating and I do not get as many orders.

There was no order form in the box with the students books, so I could easily separate them, there has been in years past. I had to go on line to my account to see whom ordered and what books. I also liked the previous way of students/parents ordered by using my class code on the booklet I sent home and ordering on line. Now I had to type a separate note explaining what the parents needed to do, scan the QR code, and make sure they select my name etc. and attach it to the booklet.

Additional Comments: I liked doing monthly orders more than 6 times a year orders.  Normally I do the September order and make it a big order so I get lots of bonus points.  This is the first year in a long time where I didn't do the first order of the year.  I normally submit an order every month.  I missed the first order because I wasn't aware of how it was working this year which may be my fault not Scholastics.  I don't like having a set date where parent orders must be done by.  I also liked being able to accept paper order forms.  Even though there were not many submitted that way, I liked having the option for parents.  I do appreciate Scholastic and the continued support of teachers with free books, etc.  I will continue to use Scholastic for as long as I teach.  I just wanted to share my thoughts.  Thanks.

What could we improve: My parent orders were automatically submitted before I could do my teacher order. I wish I had received a warning that this was going to happen so I could have completed my order (with any coupons/bonuses that I could apply).

What could we improve: Faster delivery times
I have REPEATEDLY asked for Pre-K flyers to be sent to me.  None have arrived.
Website is difficult to navigate when searching for a specific age and/or set of books
Additional Comments: The quality of some of the books in a set I received are not good and the prices are too high

I have had so much on my plate, I am grateful that I was able to send it out to parents, they ordered, (I even had someone order off my wishlist) and then when I kept telling myself that I would come back and finish and complete the order, it was just done for me.  I really appreciated that because it probably wouldn't have happened for another week or two and it was done just in time for parent/teacher conferences.  It made ordering easier and I definitely think I will be more inclined to doing more orders in the future.

I wish I could set my own due date, but otherwise everything is fine. Please do consider contacting the Book Fairs division to let them know that I disapprove of the decision to segregate the diverse books -- it sends the message that you approve of the harmful state laws. As Scholastic is a trusted publisher of diverse books that fill my classroom, I expect you to be an advocate for #WeNeedDiverseBooks.

What could we improve: Go back to the original flyers for families to order from
Additional Comments: No

What could we improve: I would like for students to have the option of ordering online OR bringing order form to school with money.

Additional Comments: I would love to see some sort of Booksource Classroom type service added to Scholastic.  It's not only an extremely powerful tool for teachers to manage their classrooms but you're missing out on a huge data collection system that could provide you valuable insights on Educator/Student Library Use and what types of books/literature are popular and/or could be recommended for purchase.

I would love for there to be $1 books again.  I love being able to give my students a book every month to help build their libraries.  I only have 3-4 families that order books every year.  So giving them this gift is wonderful.  It's been very disappointing not having that privilege this year.

What could we improve: It took more than three 3x Representatives to assist me in obtaining a quote for a few items we needed to purchase for our school. In addition, when someone did email me about this issue, it still took two 2x more attempts from other Representatives to assist me in getting a quote. I am the person who handles all purchases for our school site and this was very frustrating as we are trying to meet our District deadlines to finalize all purchases. It makes me NOT want to purchase any more items from Scholastic as it is too difficult to obtain a simple quote.

Additional Comments: Stop pushing inappropriate books on family and children.

What could we improve: A quicker way to inexpensive books.

The new ordering system is terrible!  Not all families can order online. Without an order form on the flyer and a way to track who ordered what (not online), the ordering is extremely cumbersome and difficult. I am also not happy that you no longer provide an envelope to make payments.
Additional Comments: I have been a Scholastic customer for close to 30 years.  I am seriously thinking about no longer ordering.  I DO NOT LIKE the changes that have been made.

What could we improve: I do not like the new date restrictions

Additional Comments: I can no longer afford to purchase books for my class because the cheapest book is $3 & I don't have enough points. Parents just don't hardly order anymore and it's harder to accumulate points.

What could we improve: nothing

Additional Comments: I would like a bigger selection of books that cost $1-$2.  This would help make the books more affordable.  Thanks so much!

What could we improve: You do not offer half as much as you did before. Also second and third grade should not be lumped together. Second you are still learning to read and third you are reading to learn.
Additional Comments: Please offer more options and please stop charging broke teachers for shipping! I’ve given your company a lot of business over 23 years!
The ordering and delivery process is so easy and efficient!

What could we improve: I am very unsatisfied with the changes you've made to things this year.  First of all, I had to request an upper level flier for October.  I still have not received any fliers for November.  Another thing that I am unhappy with is the fliers themselves.  I only had one family order anything in October because it says something about joining a club which families do not want to do.  They want to be able to order a book for their learner once in a while, and your fliers make it look as if they have to join a club in order to get books.  I was NOT going to give you all of my student's family's emails.  I don't think that is my place or responsibility.  I have been a red apple teacher for several years, ordering every month during the previous school years.  I won't be sending a November flier out because I have nothing to send and by the time you send me one, it will be too late.  I'm not sure what the rest of the year holds for me if things continue the way they are.  I do have a feeling that you're going to lose a great deal of business though.

I'm just frustrated because I submitted checks at the beginning of the year and the balance on my end is incorrect.  I've called customer service twice and they don't understand what is going on but they do show a greater balance and that all of the checks were received on their end, it just doesn't show me the correct balance.
Delivery date ore accurate and delivery to occur early enough in the day that books could have gone home that day rather than the next day.
nothing
Offer more $1 or $2 books and more in Spanish.
I would like to pick the due date on my orders. I would also like to combine my points from my previous name to my current name.
Bring back teacher ability to enter student on-line orders.
Additional Comments: Bring back teacher ability to enter student on-line orders.  Rural students need this service.

What could we improve: Cheaper books
I wish that teachers could set their own due dates.
Additional Comments: I wish there were $1 books again and a better selection of $2 books.

What could we improve: I don't like that ordering is strictly online now. I had a grandparent write a check and wasn't sure what to do with it. Plus, I had to send a separate check to include the tax that the grandparent wasn't aware of. I sent the checks and was glad I had a Scholastic envelope to do so. Will your envelopes now become obsolete with the online ordering only?
Additional Comments: Your prices overall are so high that I'm not getting the student orders like I used to get. My monthly orders are less than $50 now and they used to be in the $70-$100 range. I feel there's now less money for you, fewer points for me, fewer books for children at home and in the classroom. So sad.

What could we improve: Translated parent like in the past

Additional Comments: Shipping time was exceptional!  My kids were very excited to receive their books so quickly!

What could we improve: Quicker delivery.
Books can sometimes slide in shipping and arrive bent or damaged.
Additional Comments: I really love that you changed how your flyers are fastened into a booklet…no more staples! So much more user friendly!

I recently received an email about your Everyone’s Story Should Be Shared catalog. If your company actually believed this, let your actions show it. These quality stories that focus on BIPOC and LGBTQ experiences and creators belonging to those populations ought to be incorporated in all of your book fliers and book fair offerings. SEGREGATING these titles indicates that Scholastic does not truly believe that everyone’s story should be shared. You clearly know better. But you have lost customers’ trust until you choose to DO BETTER. The children you serve deserve it. And the Constitution upholds the right to free speech.

Hello,You are the best! I appreciate everything you do to help with learning to read and promoting the love of reading for our students. However, I really do miss all the wonderful flyers to send home to families. It seems you are sending less flyers. I can tell you my students love "shopping" and looking at all their book choices. Please don't ever get rid of the monthly classroom flyers! We love them!

What could we improve: I wish the deliveries came faster.  I got an email telling me it was on its way on a Monday.   I told the students it was on its way, it didn't get to me until the kids were gone on Friday, I felt like I lied to them, I thought it would be there at least before they left on Friday.
Nothing
Not sure
Additional Comments: N/a

What could we improve: I would love more choices for my points.  I’d love something just for me.
Additional Comments: I know you are struggling just as we all are.  Keep up the good work.
More value packs for teachers.  Easier to find on site without having a flyer.

What could we improve: I was unaware of the new updates and how I couldn't change my due date. I have since found that the flyers are seasonal rather than monthly and have found the schedule of due dates. While I'm coming around to that, I have been receiving my flyers late, so I feel my students' families don't have as much time to make decisions as they have in the past. Maybe things will get better with time, but it was certainly an adjustment for Sept and Oct.

I was disappointed when a parent placed an order online and before my week deadline for families to order was over, scholastic submitted the order without checking with me, the teacher. I would appreciate if I could give my families a week to place their orders and then I could submit the orders as a teacher and get the rewards allotted to me to use for my class. When Scholastic submits the order ahead of my deadline, I lose out on the total bonus points or dollars to spend for my class.

Additional Comments: I like the new flyer format.

What could we improve: Everything is great!

I am new to the system and I did not know that I had to go into my account and send off my students orders for them to receive.  Had I not ordered my own books, I do not know if they would have received their books on time.
Make it easier for teacher to have access to a live student view of the class page. teacher should have more creative freedom to change visual components of class page.

Overall the expereince is very easy to select and buy books. Unfortunately, I do not buy as much anymore since the price of books have gone up. One of the main reasons why teachers loved Scholastic was due to the affordability of books and having the opportunity to buy their students books at a reasonable price.
Parents ordering online is a good idea. However, this isn’t a method that fits all communities. I have gone from having several student orders to one student.
Additional Comments: I loved Scholastic as a child. It was one of my favorite things to take home and look over. That’s why I started doing it as a teacher. I have been a golden apple teacher in the past. I used my points for class sets of book. With the big changes now, I think I can’t do Scholastic anymore. Ordering online doesn’t work will all communities. I only had one order this past month. For me, this has been crushing. Ordering books from scholastic was one way that students would get excited about reading.

What could we improve: Please bring back some of the traditional ordering pieces; a place for student names for order, order forms, tally charts, order forms, etc
Additional Comments: Please bring back Tab, and additional middle school or high school options. We love Scholastic.  It's an American tradition.

What could we improve: Nothing off the tops of my head
I do not enjoy the new ordering process where we are forced into a due date.
Additional Comments: I would love if you brought back setting your own due dates.

What could we improve: I do not like that online orders have their own due date.
The new process where parents must order online is limiting to some families. You are losing business because kids can’t just bring in their piggy bank money to buy books
You do a great job, I appreciate the resources and usually the price
Nothing, thank you.
Additional Comments: Thanks.

What could we improve: bring back dollar books for teachers!
Additional Comments: bring back dollar books for teachers!
The Scholastic customer service person I contacted through live chat made it quick and easy to remove the sales tax from my order.

What could we improve: So far I'm not a fan of the autosubmission process.  I like to be able to submit the order when I'm ready.
Additional Comments: Again, I prefer to submit my  own order.  I really didn't like that the previous order was automatically submitted.  I had a couple of students turn-in an order 2 days later and I had to do a separate order.  I'm hoping there is a way to opt out of auto submission.

What could we improve: Nothing
Additional Comments: No comments

What could we improve: less expensive
Additional Comments: Need a better spanish selection

What could we improve: The book selections are not as good as in the past.  Books are on the flyer and already sold out.  The deals aren't as affordable as before for educators.

I've been having trouble with all the changes you've implemented. I'm not a fan of the scheduling, automatic submitting of orders, the flyers, etc. There are so many toys in the flyers now! I miss the AR level in the flyers for each book as well. It has been hard for me to track down things that used to be really intuitive and easy on the website. Sorry, I'm sure it's all for making it easier and better somehow, but I'm not a fan.
Book prices are getting too high for the population I serve.  The flyers highlight the more expensive books.
For several days I was unable to get on to the Scholastic website to place the order. The link in the email ingot telling me there was a student order waiting didn’t work.
I miss getting magazines and setting my own date
Nothing, everything was good.
Prices are higher.  No $1 or $2 books anymore.

Additional Comments: This experience was much better than my previous orders.

What could we improve: I don't like the new ordering format. I like to make my own due dates and enjoyed the book selection and prices better in previous years. I also miss the packs of 5 or 10 of the same books. I ordered those to give my class as a gift.
Bring back $1 books. Allow me to add my $.12 balance to my order
The books took way too long to be delivered
Bring back $1 books
Additional Comments: As a first grade teacher, I love to buy the $1 books for my students (with my own money) every month because a lot of them do not have books at home. Since taking the $1 books away, I’m no longer able to do that.
I’d like to see more books you have available to buy through your scholastic bookstore available in your book clubs and book fairs.

What could we improve: Offer better quality books. You are missing books from tried and true authors.
To have the book code from the ordering catalog in the packing list. It was a little confusing because the code on the packaging list was different that the catalog.
Additional Comments: No at this time

The only comment I have is with the points. I may order the books that my students paid for all at once and not be able to get the designated bonus points needed becasue I placed another order a few days later. Students sometimes are late to place their orders even though I wait until the latest to place my order. But when I go back to place the late order it doesnt give me the full bonus points that I should receive to get extra books or free books to spend. That's all but overall I am happy with Scholastic.

What could we improve: I am disappointed that the items in my cart were automatically checked out and delivered without having had the opportunity for the $10 to spend now in that I’m used to. The set ordering deadline and inability to edit the parent letter with a deadline of my choice is very annoying.
Additional Comments: Not happy with the changes regarding automatic checkout without $10 to spend now and not being able to set my own ordering deadline

What could we improve: I believe the books are not as cheap as they use to be. The great thing about scholastic is affordable books for our children. This is not the case. Less $1 books.  It is sad to see the size of books cut as well. It is hard for little eyes to read books that have been shaved off. The print is smaller. I love scholastic books and have bought for 25 years but the quality of books are not the same.
Nothing! Fast and easy
Finding parent orders is very confusing.
Prices have increased and I’d like more high quality books.

Additional Comments: Great experience
I think the teacher should set the due date because when a parent is late - they lose out on the e order going into the total amount for higher points.

What could we improve: Having books on CD. It was wonderful when you had a monthly collection (4 books and 4 CDs). This is my listening center and the students love seeing the CDs
Additional Comments: Having a lower price for the special feature books. It’s gone up since last year. I love chick g my students books to enjoy. But if the price of these special books keeps going up I will have to find something else. 20x the price of your books adds up and on a teachers salary that’s pricy
I have used Scholastic for many years as an educator and have never been disappointed!
Book prices have increased too much. No more $1 books. Parents aren’t ordering as much if at all this year.

What could we improve: I had all online orders and forgot to add my free books. Maybe it can transfer to the next month if that happens?!? I miss the option to pick my own day I want the orders due
Additional Comments: Bring back $1 or $2 dollar books!

What could we improve: Nothing, your website was easy to use.
Additional Comments: Thank you

What could we improve: Many parents will not order with the online order only option. Otherwise, putting in the order and getting the books was great!
Not charge for shipping when using my bonus points for an order.
Additional Comments: Due to the direction Scholastic is taking regarding the content of books that is being pushed, I will not be offering this book club to my students' families.  It is unfortunate that Scholastic has bought into the propaganda of forcing young children to be thinking about ideas and ideology that has no place in their development or in a school, for that matter.

What could we improve: I wish that we could still pick our sale dates, I don't like the lack of affordable book options, there used to be $2, $3 and I don't see that any more
Additional Comments: I feel like Scholastic has become less user friendly. I went ahead and spent all of my points that I have been accumulating because I am unsure at this point if I will continue to order. I do not like the new format of being assigned a sale date. I remember there being $2 and $3 sale books in the flyer so that there were affordable options for everyone.

What could we improve: When students are not in school because of holiday or weekend, the delivery should be attempted during school hours so they don't get sent all the way back to your company as undeliverable.

Additional Comments: I think the book price points are too high. I used to order all the time but now, not so much. I understand these everything has gone up. It’s just not affordable for some families

What could we improve: The paper flyers are easier to view than online searching but paper copies seems to be greatly reduced this year. What is in them seems to be more toys and kits than good quality books.
Allow teachers to set their own due date and then if the orders are not processed within a week automatically process the orders.

We seem to have lost the benefit of extra books for our school when you automatically place our orders. Without the benefit to the school, we don’t see the advantage of continuing to offer scholastic sales to our families
Additional Comments: We want to place our total order all at one time and be allowed to use the pints to purchase books for our school
Thank you for providing this service for our students.

What could we improve: Parent orders that are not done online by parent results in a teacher paying for taxes.  the teacher is putting in their order but ends paying out of pocket for their taxes.
There was another teacher's packing slip inside rather than mine. All of the correct books were there. I had to sign into my account to figure out whose books were whose.
I love how you used to include a form letter that can be copied with the paper book order forms. Noticed that there weren’t any on the book orders this time.
The delivery date was on the last day of October. I would like to be able to change the day that the orders process in order to make sure my students get books before any important dates and holidays

Additional Comments: I have been promoting and purchasing scholastic books for my students for 26 years. I am VERY DISAPPOINTED that you are no longer offering many of the tech items in the bonus catalog. I have saved thousands of points in order to collect enough to redeem them for some of the high point items that you have decided for teachers that they no longer need them. I hope you bring them back otherwise I will not be promoting the purchasing of scholastic books with my students and parents.

What could we improve: It was easy for families to order online and then it was delivered to school
The small selection of books in the flyer, the set due dates are no convenient either

The website is now very confusing when I log in it seems like I am on a student/parent site, not my teacher site.  I randomly get different age flyers and not enough for all my students. The date is confusing....I had an late October date and my flyer was October Halloween books....my order date is so late that the Halloween books from the flyer would arrive after Halloween.  I am still confused about the assigned order date. Can I place all my parents orders prior to that date or do I have to wait until the due date to place student orders.
Nothing that I can think of.
Offer $1 books again and more choices at lower price points for those of us in low-income school districts
Additional Comments: Please go back to the old way of doing Scholastic Book Clubs.  I understand printing monthly fliers may have been more expensive but the quarterly ones and books at higher prices are not of interest to the families I serve.

What could we improve: I liked it better when we could select our own order due by dates.
The website isnt as user-intuitive as it could be.

Parents submitted an online order and my order was placed by Scholastic for shipping in about half a week. I wanted to place a Teacher order with it and felt I needed more time. I did call and speak to a representative who was able to submit my order with the online order so I didn’t have to pay the extra shipping charges, in the future, I would like to be able to submit my order myself.
Additional Comments: The representative I spoke to was very helpful and patient in placing my order and waving the shipping charge this time.

What could we improve: Provide more bilingual books

Additional Comments: Easy to use the website. I called customer service and they answered within a minute and answered my question in a polite and friendly way in under a minute.
Thank you for making books affordable for kids and families.

What could we improve: Not all of my students have internet access. Paper orders are their only option. Bring back paper orders.
Additional Comments: I  would like to set my own due date.

What could we improve: It is very difficult for families to order now that your flyers do not include a back page order form.  Also, why do you know longer send an envelope to make our payments?
Additional Comments: I would like to see less "toy" type items in the flyers and more variety of books for young students.

What could we improve: Allow parents to send orders to school as was done in the past
Allowed me to have the order sent to my home rather than to school.
Wrap each order together so it is easier to distribute
packaging better
I don’t like how the parents can only order online. Our parents want the old system back where they sent me cash or a check, and I made the purchase for them.
I want to be able to ship directly to my school. It does not let me edit the address. The address goes to the district warehouse then to my school. That takes sometimes 2 extra weeks for delivery.
Email warning that online orders we’re going to automatically process so I could enter my teacher order with the bonuses and incentives
Bring back the $1.00 and the extra bonus points and easier way to enter orders
Since the due date is already set up, it was difficult to remember and I almost missed it.
Some Of my parents don’t like that it’s totally online for ordering.
I would like to still have the option to add student orders.  My students parents do not know how to order it. The order sheet was helpful as well.
Go back to the old system of choosing your own due date.  Offer more low-cost choices.
Additional Comments: Really dislike the new format.  Want the old way back including more low-cost options to encourage ordering and better access for ALL families.

What could we improve: Couldn’t get the order due date for parents online to change.  I wanted to set my own date, not use your automatic date.
Additional Comments: Still don’t like your new flyers.  There is no description, however brief, for the books in your flyer.  This makes it impossible for me to recommend a book or books to parents when they ask.  And the flyer itself is just too busy!
I’ve been very pleased with Scholastic

What could we improve: We need to be able to type in the student's name when we place our book club order - we used to be able to do that.
Prices are high
Why only one book this year? Book prices have gone up???

Additional Comments: I have been ordering books for years and years. In the last few years our community has done a trunk or treat night where kids can trick or treat at the sports park. I am a part of our reading council and we give out books instead of candy. We have carefully ordered from your sets and dollar book club to make this happen. This year we have out about 1,000 books. I am sad to say that your prices have gone up so much that we are very concerned about being able to continue our tradition. We would love to see the dollar book club return! The kids really enjoy the books!
Offer more $1 or $2 deals in your flyers and more bonus points. That would be awesome!!!
I'm glad to hear you walked back your stance on banned books. You shouldn't cowtow to bullies who are afraid their kids might learn something new

What could we improve: allow teachers to order for students again
Additional Comments: the parents of my students don't have credit cards and cannot order things online. Please make it an option for teachers to order for students again.
Thank you for making ordering books easy.

What could we improve: Start putting the invoice in the box again  with the shipment  so we don’t have to wait for the bill to be emailed

Additional Comments: I advocated for our school to have a Scholastic book fair. I was disappointed to see that books could be segregated at that time and diverse books did not have to be presented if opted out. I am somewhat satisfied that your company decided to retract that option, but in the future, please stand with solidarity with LGBTQIA books and BIPOC books. Please never waver For inclusivity.

What could we improve: The new format of the website is somewhat confusing, but I am getting used to it.
Nothing...it was good.

Additional Comments: I like the now format of the order date due and when to place the order.

What could we improve: Offer books with CD.
Additional Comments: I would love a wider variety of book titles to choose from and less choices based on movies, toys, etc.
My order was great as always! Thank you! :)

What could we improve: Two of my students ordered little mini glitter notebooks. Two different notebooks were sent (one was pink and one was green with a frog). One of my students was jealous of the other one getting the pink notebook, so she stole the pink notebook from the other student. If two students order the same item, if you could delineate which item is to go to which student, or else send two of the same thing, it would be appreciated. Thank you.
more books that are under 2.00
More of a selection of traditional books that don't contain political agendas and indoctrination of little minds.
I liked being able to set my own delivery date. Order was shipped before I could add teacher items.

E process and delivery were fine, as always, but I am still stuck on the fact that all student orders are expected to be completed by parents online. That is not some thing that is preferred or expected by the families in my school. They deal with cash and would prefer to just send it to school and have me do the ordering online as the teacher. It feels as if the company has taken a step back to 10 years ago.
It would have been great if the package did not get returned due to damage, but that was out of your control (delivery process).

Additional Comments: Please bring back the dollar books...verify teachers, if needed!

What could we improve: Offer the monthly $1 books. Very disappointed that this is gone.
Additional Comments: Bring monthly $1 books back.

What could we improve: not applicable
Additional Comments: It was my first time using Scholastics as a first year teacher. The whole process of ordering books was very clear.

What could we improve: Bring back following books and books of the week for those who buy in bulk for their classrooms
More books
The flyers are a disappointment with less books to choose from and we miss the $2.00 books.
Receive fliers sooner
Not set a date for me. Also, for 2nd month in a row I got a bonus pt. Coupon to use AFTER I submitted an order, making it invalid
Additional Comments: If you are going to preset my date, I should be alllowed to combine my order totals for the same month for coupon purposes, as I don’t think k students should have to wait a month to receive their books if they order early in the month.

What could we improve: Box filler so soft copy book covers are not damaged.
Additional Comments: I appreciate when hard copy book order flyers are mailed out consistently. Also, it is disappointing that the dollar books are no longer available to educators. That was my holiday gift to my students each year. :(

What could we improve: Allow me to set my own order deadline instead of your monthly one
Additional Comments: I’ll be ordering less often in the fall because you switched the bonus points- there’s no incentive to do so at the very beginning of the year

What could we improve: Nothing
I would like to set my own due dates
The new website is not working for me. I like the old one better

I really dislike the new fliers without the traditional order form. So many of the families I serve don’t have or trust online ordering. This the the first year I’ve had only one parent order one book and it’s November.
Additional Comments: Please put the order form back on your fliers.

What could we improve: The email stating that you would recieve $10 off an order was confusing. Instead of Scholastic taking $10 off the order, teachers could only use $10 to get additional books.

Additional Comments: Bring back the $1 books - I used to have book sponsors and could purchase books for every student - it is not financially possible now
Excellent service

What could we improve: Allowing the teacher to enter student orders.  Students that can't order online have to pay tax and I don't think this is equitable.  i work at a title 1 school and many parents have positions which pay them in cash and it is often easier for my students to pay in cash instead of online.
Faster shipping-order forms no longer have the section to fill out so you have to look for the books

I have very few orders being placed with the new format of the catalogs. I work in a very low income district and parents prefer to pay cash and have me order instead of ordering online with a credit card. It is a waste of time and paper for me to keep sending flyers home when only one child orders. I have tried sending the online directions and links, but it doesn’t help.

Additional Comments: We enjoy ordering books from Scholastics.

What could we improve: Cheaper prices, more options

Additional Comments: I liked being able to add my own due date for book orders.  I do not like that Scholastic doesn't let me do this anymore.

I felt the books I ordered were over priced I purchased seven books for 40 bucks. Prices and quality sure have changed. Not sure how it works to use my points into regards to getting more books for my grandkids.

What could we improve: I don't remember the date cut offs being so early in the month.

Additional Comments: I love getting the paper copies of the book flyers.  Please keep sending them!

What could we improve: Asking for students' names in their orders when their families purchase online.  Also, when the books arrive, giving students a "receipt" so I can show that I've given them all that they've purchased- so there's not question.  I typically put a large rubber band around the student's books and cut the large order receipt into little strips, taping their strip to the top book.
Additional Comments: It would also be helpful if the books that were purchased from my wishlist were identified as such, instead of the item being listed as "object, object".  To go above and beyond, it would be awesome if there was a Scholastic thank you card for each book purchased from the wishlist so I could send a thank you card, instead of using mine.
Thank you for shipping my students order that I forgotten about. Teachers get busy at times.
I would like to be able to change the due date.

What could we improve: Do not like myself not getting to set due dates and having to email parents.  Give out at beginning of month but not due till end of month…does not get them holiday books for that month and too long in between hand out and due date.  Also liked being able to out student names, class codes, and due date on flyers.  Lots of grandparents that don’t do online or know how.

Very frustrated student orders can’t be placed online by me. Families do not want to order online with credit cards. I work with low income families that don’t have credit cards. I know this isn’t your fault and the books seemed okay-but the box was destroyed by the time it was delivered to me.
I received an email saying I owed money when I do not and paid the balance when I placed the order. I shouldn't be getting an email saying I owe money when I do not.

Additional Comments: The whole process from ordering to delivery went VERY smoothly! Thank you!

What could we improve: Not allowing parents to send in orders and money has cut down greatly on the amount of parents that order.
I have noticed that this year there are less books and more gadgets and trinkets. I had trouble finding books to order.

Additional Comments: Would it be possible to continue at sell the $1 books around the holidays?

What could we improve: I wanted to suggest to please put the list of books ordered by each child/parent a little bigger.  It's just easier to read and separate the books.
I miss paper orders.
Additional Comments: I just miss allowing kids/parents to to submit a paper order and not online only.
This is my second order that my students have made.  I am VERY SATISFIED, in fact EXTREMELY HAPPY with the promptness and feasibility of ordering books from YOU!  Thank you!

What could we improve: Normally I'm super satisfied and you did replace a book that came damaged however I already spoke to one of your representatives about this issue. I realized there's no control over it but I had placed two orders on the same day and one order arrived one week and the following order arrived the next week even though they're replaced on the same day. The students were not happy having to wait while there classmate received his books.
I do t like the changes that have been made
Additional Comments: Go back to the old way

What could we improve: Email parents
Additional Comments: None

What could we improve: Tell where package was left (mailbox, door, etc)
Communicate that you no longer accept checks.
Nothing
Allow students to place order through their teacher.  Let teacher set own due date.
Additional Comments: Don’t like the book flyer.  Go back to more books with no activities.

What could we improve: No families ordered because they don’t want to use online ordering.
Bonus points in September used to be way more. With less bonus points, I’ll be buying less. Also, the number of student orders has dropped significantly due to not being able to order except online.
Additional Comments: Students need to be able to order with cash.

What could we improve: I would like the option of delivery to my house so my order doesn't get misplaced at school, or sit outside because it was delivered on a Friday afternoon or on a Saturday.
Giving teachers the ability to enter students orders who paid in cash
With the new automated order release, the order actually took longer to get here.
Set my own order due date
Additional Comments: Wish there were tech items in the bonus point catalog again. Kids love Osmo

What could we improve: Smaller packaging since it was only one book

Additional Comments: Satisfied customer!

What could we improve: I don’t like how you find class page now.   It’s cumbersome and it as easy as it used to be.
Additional Comments: QR code is not forward progress.  Make an easier way to find class page.

What could we improve: Not giving parents an order form on the flyer forced them to order online. This took out an entire socio-economic group of parents. These are the ones who are not tech savvy and will scrounge up $5.00 to send in for a book for their child. This new format doesn’t work for them and takes books out of the hands of the children who need them the most.
Additional Comments: Please go back to your old format. The new format is too busy and the book prices are unattainable for our economically challenged families.
Bring back $1 books. It was much more affordable to buy for an entire classroom!

What could we improve: I hate the lack of cheaper books and the assigned due dates!!!!
Additional Comments: Old way so much better

What could we improve: My package said deliver multiple days before it was actually delivered

Additional Comments: I would like to set a due date.

What could we improve: I really don't like your new system at all. I probably won't order again.
Allow the teacher to set the due date and more $2 book options
The books were shipped quickly, so I don't have any problems with the time frame.
Additional Comments: Many of my students are not ordering, as they can no longer pay cash. Many of my parents are low income and do not have a way to order online (no credit card, Internet, etc.)

What could we improve: Only one parent order was placed.  We usually have a large number of orders but the online ordering has discouraged most of our parents.  Several had problems ordering so skipped it altogether.  Also by not being able to make out order slips and brings them to school has eliminates many from ordering.
Additional Comments: I have no way of knowing when the parent received their order as no orders were placed to be delivered to school.  We will finish out the school year but if very few parents place orders (only 1 in October) we may not continue in the future.  I would be interested to know how the new order system is working for others.
Jennifer

What could we improve: I got an email that stated that if I placed an order during my “birthday month” then I would earn extra points that month. There did not appear to be a code that I needed to enter, however, I never got those points even though I placed an order in October and my birthday is October 1st. Please make that more clear so that other teachers do not miss out. I assume that I was supposed to enter a code or something but I didn’t see one in that email and no birthday points were added to my account during or after my October order which was disappointing. If the email was more clear about what needed to be done to earn the extra points that would have been helpful. I felt that the email implied it would be automatically added, especially since I received that email durning my birthday month. I placed a teacher order and a parent order that connected to my classroom.

Additional Comments: I would love to be able to set my own due dates. Also, I work at a Title 1 school. Many families are not comfortable shopping online. I would like to have the option for them to shop the flyer and I put in family orders.

What could we improve: I wish there was more communication about the set book order by date
I did not realize I needed to set a close order date online. If I had completed this step my ordering process would have been much more efficient. I will be setting up my next order on Monday.
I do not like the online only ordering nor the preset due date.
Please automatically submit teacher orders like the family orders. OR go back to previous version where teachers can submit both at their convenience. Thank you.
Additional Comments: Allow teachers to submit orders at their convenience  instead of having a monthly deadline. Thank you

What could we improve: Parents still want to pay with cash. Make it easier for teacher's to place students orders.
Additional Comments: I want to be able to change the order due date.
Please send me the Club Leo book catalog for my students. Thank you!

What could we improve: Website is not as inviting as it once was.
Allow student orders to be placed as previously done
Additional Comments: Please bring back student order flyers.  My parents do not place order online.  Bing back club Leo!

Much improved service. Fast delivery. Easy parent online payment. easy link sharing for families. Need more teacher and classroom incentives such as free class bookmarks, books or stickers with ever order

What could we improve: MIss $1.00 books, birthday coupons

Additional Comments: I’m disappointed that the September 10,000 points option for teachers is gone!  That option provided the best outcome for parents to order online.  Now that’s it’s gone, my families don’t have a great “buy in” frame of mind.  I hope it returns next school year!

What could we improve: Let me put my order through myself
Additional Comments: I’d like envelopes to be included in the flyers and bring back affordable books. No one orders anymore because prices have gone up so much

What could we improve: I prefer to choose my due date instead of being assigned a due date.

Additional Comments: I love the online only ordering set up!

What could we improve: Not have a minimum order price.  Teachers are not in control of the number of books that are ordered.  In the past I’ve had to cancel orders, spend more of my own money, or pay the price of the shipping.
Send email notices when parents order
Not set our deadline for parents and allow cash ordering  again !!
I am disappointed you have discontinued the $1 and $2 books. I used to give them as gifts to my students

The new way to order is awful.  The fact that parents have to order online makes it so many kids cannot get books anymore.  Working in a title 1 school, many families don’t use the internet and don’t order online.  Kids used to be able to bring their own birthday money in and buy books.  My orders used to always be over $100/month.  Now, I get 1 family to buy one book.  And, the website is so hard to navigate now.  I’ve needed customer service to help me every time. I’ve been ordering scholastic for over 25 years, and will probably stop now.
I have ordered from Scholastic for forever.  I changed my teaching stays and had to answer far too many questions concerning this.
Not automatically submit orders!!!!
I received more student orders in the past when they were able to send in cash or check and didn’t have to order online.
Additional Comments: Please stop requiring online ordering from families. Some parents won’t order for their children. These children used to bring in their own payments and orders. Now they’re unable to do this.

What could we improve: Ordering process is easy.   Increase in prices has been a frustration for school families.

I was not aware that scholastic changed their ordering process where it will automatically send orders even after reading much of the scholastic materials being sent. I wish that it was better communicated to prevent confusion. I used to send monthly, but now the schedule is different. Having a different schedule is fine but I was not clear on the process.
Additional Comments: I spoke with customer service and they were amazing

I have a class that loves to read this year! I would like to be able to set my own due dates for book orders.  The current schedule conflicts with our time off so I won't be able to have a book order again until January :(

The set due dates do NOT work for my classroom schedule as a teacher. Only having 3 flyers for the entire fall (Sept.-Dec.) does not help getting books into the hands of my first graders. Also, the prices of your books have become TOO HIGH for many of my families and they are not ordering any longer.

What could we improve: I was unable to access my $10 credit and wanted to get a couple of things. I was a little dismayed by that but that was the only issue I had
Additional Comments: The C/S agent that I chatted with online was courteous and professional!

What could we improve: It’s not the service in ordering, but the new catalogs, or lack thereof. The selection of ore-k books seems much more limited and the books aren’t as good as in years past.

A parent told me they placed an order through my acct. when I checked there was no order. So I thought the order would ship to her house. The order shipped to my school and since I did t know it was coming I didn’t watch for it to arrive. It sat in the school office until another teacher saw it and brought it to me.
I would prefer the option to have the delivery come to my house.  This is only in regards to order to delivery
Additional Comments: I am not thrilled with the new flyer format.  Your book costs are becoming too high.  I miss the $1 & $2 books.  That made it easy to get books for our students as gifts.

What could we improve: quicker delivery and preferred previous book order forms. There was a better selection.
More selection on flyers!  Only received preschool, we also have infant and toddlers.

It is awful that you have taken away the teacher's ability to put family orders in. You are giving far too much credit to families' time to figure out and complete orders, ability to figure out the technology, access to technology and so much more. You are limiting our ability to include all families.

Parents are not ordering. I wish the flyers had an easily accessible web address and a place for me to write the code and date in. We are not provided email addresses to add them to the digital format

Additional Comments: I love giving my student's parents a way to get books that the children enjoy reading. It is easy to order and the books come to the school in a timely manner.

What could we improve: Go back to the old ordering system. I want to be able to submit my own orders every month and I want to be able to apply my own rewards
Additional Comments: Go back to the old system.

What could we improve: email status of order
Let me choose my own order due date. Allow parents to pay with cash in class. Parents don't want to order in my neighborhood online

Additional Comments: Wish there was an order form for students to mark what they are ordering.

What could we improve: I am not completely comfortable sending home the fliers anymore based on some featured books.
I was definitely expecting a normal size chapter book for the price I paid for a class set. I did not see that coming.
Additional Comments: Refund $ and points for the cost of the 25 class set of the Dragon book or provide a class set of the regular size. 👍

What could we improve: I am disappointed with the overall program.  Prices have gotten really expensive, selection limited and very little incentive to offer Scholastics
Additional Comments: I am disappointed in all of the recent changes made by Scholastic books.  The selection of books has gone down but prices have increased.  I used to be able to get value packs for a reasonable price to give to preschool families but not anymore.  The coupons are not great and all in all I will probably discontinue using Scholastics after this school year.

What could we improve: I do not like that I cannot set a specific due date on my teacher page and do not like the new flyer format.
Additional Comments: Please add more dollar books so teachers can buy them for their students and go back to the old flyer format.

What could we improve: The delivery was ok but I miss the good deals like added bonus points and coupons I used to get.
Additional Comments: Pls bring back the extra bonus points, coupons and $2 holiday gift books. Selection is poor now. Also my school went with another company for book fair because of decreased service from scholastic.
Thank you

What could we improve: The due date is confusing as it doesn’t correspond to when I get my flyers. I liked it better when I could set my own date.

Additional Comments: Love the quick turnaround! Parents love the choices and value … thank you for being reliable and dependable!  EVERYONE remembers Book Order forms! Their smiles and joy upon receiving them is priceless to watch!

What could we improve: The books were fine, but the box looks like it had a rough journey.

Additional Comments: The amount of families that ordered has drastically decreased from past years, I’m disappointed in the price increases.

What could we improve: Dollar books
Additional Comments: Please bring back dollar books

Please bring back more flyer options for our students. I know you can view them online, but the kids like having flyer in their hands and they circle their wishlist items.  One flyer is not enough. We enjoyed the Lucky and Arrow choices.  Also please go back to adding more books instead of non book items to your flyer. There also seems to be more pencil activities.  As a teacher that is a waste of book advertisement space.
Delivery has been about 7 days.  That’s great!

What could we improve: 1/2 of my classroom order was submitted before my classroom due date. I didn’t understand why that happened. I’ve never had that happen before.

Additional Comments: I would love it if you added back target gift cards for teacher perks

What could we improve: I was unable to access my teacher account.  This is not the first time this has happened.  My only option was to select forgot my password.  I chose this option no less than 6 times and never received a password reset.  This has happened multiple times before.  I do not have time to deal with this so I tell parents to go to scholastic to place their own orders or just don’t order at all.  I have stopped distributing the fliers as a result.
I prefer to have parents use the classroom code

I really enjoyed last year being able to unlock the $1 bookstore. It's disappointing that is not offered anymore.  I also liked having shipping directly to my house with no charge because that allowed me to sort the books at home then take them into the classroom already sorted. There does not seem to be as many good deals.

Additional Comments: You guys are doing an awesome job!! Thank you!
Bring back $1 books for teachers to order.

What could we improve: Going back to the way it all has been for the last 25 years!

Additional Comments: Wondering how I apply teacher credit (i.e. $10 dollars to spend on over $50 orders when Scholastic submits the order automatically...)

What could we improve: I would like to still be able to choose when orders are due.
Additional Comments: Again, being able to choose the order due date.

When asking parents to place online orders, it would help to have them enter first name and last name and for that to be printed on the delivery sheet. We had a student with the same name as someone else and books were mixed up.

What could we improve: The book selection is not as good this year.
Bring back the $1.00 books for teachers to give as gifts.
Additional Comments: Bring back the $1.00 books

What could we improve: Make it easier to find books and know what is available through scholastic

The shipping was fast and my order was complete, but I’m disappointed in the selection of books for my second graders.  They are crazy about Junie B Jones and there were only a few titles available. Looking for more variety for my beginning chapter book readers!
Additional Comments: Bring back the option for teachers to place student orders and separate books by student. Not all of my parents are able to or know how to order online, and many pay me with cash for class orders.
Love scholastic! Always happy with their service and quality of books :)
My families really enjoy ordering books from Scholastic.

What could we improve: Bring back the $1 books or the $10 for 10 book value packs.
I like the paper copy of the letter to send with a paper catalog for parent orders.
Let teachers choose their own due date
Additional Comments: I prefer the style of flyers from years past which do not include the games and such. Just books.
Flyers come late - books are very expensive- no more $1 or $2 books - that’s disappointing

What could we improve: Please bring back the ability to enter student names for separate orders.   Parents in the community I teach don't really have smart phones. They also don't really feel comfortable creating accounts and putting their credit card info online to buy things.
My wishlist was removed. More available books.
book prices are no longer a good deal

I like to choose my own due date
Additional Comments: Give us back control of ordering date.

What could we improve: Unfortunately, the price of your books have gone up to the point I as a teacher can not afford to get them any longer.

What could we improve: There was no communication for parent orders and how it was being processed. So parents connected to the wrong account.
More deals
As a teacher i prefer to pick my own due dates and I’m not receiving the flyers on time to send my letter home
Go back to the old way Scholastic worked!
Additional Comments: Please go back to the old way Scholastic worked… this is not great. I am not the only teacher feeling this way.

What could we improve: I miss your $1 books. I did a campaign through scholastic to purchase $1 books for our entire grade level this year (1 book each child each month). We won't be able to get a book a month for all due to the cancelling of the $1 book a month program.  It would have been nice to know this before I started my campaign,
Additional Comments: Bring back the $1 book selections.

What could we improve: Let parents pay by check again

Additional Comments: More opportunities for teachers to buy the same book at cheaper prices for students.

What could we improve: Service is great!
Additional Comments: I love how the online family orders get shipped automatically! Wonderful idea!

What could we improve: It's been many years since I have ordered so only ordering online (for parents and teachers) was different. Once I get used to navigating the site and figuring out how the bonus points and such work, it will be easier.

What could we improve: I do not like how parent orders are submitted automatically on a date that is not even the last day or first day of the month. I provide my parents with specific dates that I will submit the order and am not able to put in my teacher order with additional points for that order.

Additional Comments: The only concern was they delivered on a weekend the first time. The I work at is only Monday thru Friday.

What could we improve: I received an email saying my package had been delivered before it had actually arrived.
very difficult figuring out how to get free books based on amount students spent

Additional Comments: I appreciate the specials you offer. Hosting the $10-off special encouraged me to place my order for my classroom. Please continue with these special offers.

What could we improve: They did great.

Additional Comments: The process of ordering books was very easy and streamlined.

What could we improve: One of my books was bent and damaged in the box

The website can be a bit awkward to navigate if you are new to the updates. I haven't ordered in a few years, but going from my page to find the items my students ordered took me a bit of time. Can you create a quick tab for teachers to access that?  The first delivery attempt said no one was here. It's a public elementary school campus, obviously the office is only open from 7:30 am until about 4:00pm. Why did they attempt to deliver before or after those times? It was a bit frustrating when I received an email stating I was getting them "today" but it ended up being the next day. I don't know if you can communicate that to the post office, but I know you do pay a significant amount to them for delivery of your books.  Overall, I love your company and appreciate the low prices on valuable books my families need in order to provide books for their children. Thank you! Diana McBride
Bring back the $1 books, please!
Either go back to order forms at school or eliminate the teacher having to submit the orders.
The company delivering the order should be aware of the school hours.
Additional Comments: The new flyers were not included in the box.

What could we improve: Allow me to change class due date.
Additional Comments: None

What could we improve: I do not like the new way of ordering...Getting the materials was fine but it was very difficult to place a teacher order
Make it easier for teachers to place student orders online for students.
N/A
I had one item arrive that was broken.

I had to pay taxes for my students, twice because this my second orders for the year. The book order did not include taxes like last year. I called customer service and they could not help me. They say it’s the company’s new policy.
Additional Comments: Put the tax back in so we don’t have to deal with taxes.

What could we improve: The fact that I have to put student orders under teacher orders because you only except online orders from students. Then you placed my one online order before I could place the order for the student who brought in money. I had to call customer service to get the shipping charges dropped.
Additional Comments: I am no longer ordering anything from you. I feel you made changes that help you but hinder your clients- teachers.
Thank you for being efficient and informing us precisely when and where.

What could we improve: Timing and packaging damaged.

You need to include the teacher's name on the outside of the box.  There are several teachers at my school who order from Scholastic.  Without the name on the outside, the boxes then have to be opened.
Your new system in which students and parents have to order online is difficult with the population at my school.  It was much  easier with the old forms.
Additional Comments: I wish that there weren't any of the accessories/toys available.  I wish it was just books for the kids to order.

What could we improve: I miss the pay by check option.
Better communication

Additional Comments: I did not try to track my shipment so perhaps give an N/A choice along with Yes and No.
It would be really helpful if teachers got an email letting them know when parents have submitted orders online so we know to go on the website and get them shipped.

What could we improve: As a teacher, that is the side of the website I typically use.  I don't usually use the order as a parent version of the website, but when I try to go to the Book Clubs website, it jumps back and forth.  Sometimes it signs me in as a parent automatically and then I have to catch that and change to Order as a Teacher.  I was also disappointed to see some of the technology options available for bonus points are gone.  I've been saving my points for that, and did not know they would no longer be available with new bonus point items.
I guess I don't have to review the order, so I never got a chance to add to it.
For Class orders, not have to contact you to get tax exempt invoice.

Additional Comments: Everything was delivered in a timely manner and organized well.
Great service and selection!  Thank you!

What could we improve: Send flyers with book orders

You could have mailed my books to ME.  I got an email on Thursday, October 26th, that my book box was delivered.  I never got it.  I never got it on Friday, October 27th.  On Monday, October 30th, I contacted the secretary.  We started looking for it and contacting people.  She sent out an email to the entire school, to which no one responded. FINALLY, we found it.  MY order was in a box shipped to Bridget Bond.  However, the printout that was in the box, and addressed to "Bridget Bond" had my name, repeatedly, under the "ATTN" column.  Bridget had 2 books in the two boxes.  I had 152 books in the boxes.
Still learning the new system so some adjustments there.  Miss the dollar books
I would like control over when my class book order is due.

A first time Scholastic buyer (parent) said the ordering process for her was too confusing.  I did not receive complaints about the ordering process when we had to provide a class code to connect the parent with my class.

Additional Comments: Please bring back the teacher points prizes that were taken away. I was building up my points for a Macbook and the apple products are now gone. So frustrating after years of building up my points.

What could we improve: The changes with student orders is disappointing. I work at a title one school. Most of my students pay in cash. I also often have students bring 1-3 dollars, all they have, but who want to purchase something.   No longer having the option to enter student orders made the ordering more difficult and I have heard a few other teachers at my school say the same. Also, I didn’t know about the changes, and when you search scholastic student orders that page came up so I had entered the orders that way. But, when I went back to the orders a few days later, those orders and the one parent order I had disappeared.   I was able to easily retrieve the online order by calling customer service. I had to re enter all the other orders.   I wish scholastic would consider changing back to student orders, as well as find a way to provide cheaper books like you once had. I always appreciated the $1 books for my students.

processing and shipping took to long. Halloween is over, we ordered Halloween books.

I don't suspect many orders this year.

Going to only digital ordering discriminates against families that are lower income. Please bring back cash options for families to send in money to the teacher-with actual order forms. I have never had such a low order in all my years teaching than this one now that you are only digital.

Doing good

Additional Comments: Was pleasantly surprised at how fast my order arrived.

What could we improve: It would be nice to have the prepaid envelope in the book orders.  Some parents do not have the means to pay online and would prefer to send a check; therefore, they did not order books.

An email sent by your company stated that students who ordered after the order deadline would be automatically sent.  It was not.  I got an email a month later stating that I "had a student order waiting."  pleas allow teachers to submit their own deadlines like we used to be able to.
have it ship sooner

Prices are too high, there is no longer the option of 1.00 book of the month, no more extra books for the amount you order. I am more pleased with the selection and prices I find on Amazon

What could we improve: Your ordering system changed from last year and it makes it difficult to take and manage cash orders. Also the way tax is applied also makes things troublesome.

Scholastic is always great to purchase books from. Thank you for providing great resources and timely service.

nothing that I can think of

I was disappointed that the birthday coupons were no longer offered. I have used those for the last 4 or 5 years to allow all of the kids to be able to pick out books each month. This allowed those kids who couldn't afford to buy a book to get a new book. I am sad that the lack of selection and the rising cost makes this a program that I will not be using in the future.

What could we improve: It would be helpful if spending bonus dollars could be saved if we have to add more to the order

The one register situation was awful. We had a line that took almost 2 hours to get through at parent night. Processing online card sales by manually calculating taxes and totals without an efficient receipt printing solution was hardly a fix. Whoever suggested this has not been in a crowded book fair in the past few years.   The fair was delivered really early and picked up really late, so my library was dysfunctional for almost two weeks.   My text notifications about arrival were weeks late. I just received the notification about the fair pick up a few days ago.   Customer service, including my rep, were rude and attempted to gaslight me by saying I was the only one with the issues I brought to their attention, even though other librarians in my district had the same issues AND different reps informed me these were nationwide issues.   I rely on All for Books round ups to prevent counting a lot of change, these were being taxed therefore making whole dollar amounts impossible to calculate. I spent so much time counting pennies. Customer service had conflicting info about how to resolve this issue each time I called. I eventually gave up because it was wasting my time.   I run classes during the fair and have extremely limited volunteer support. This fair was a nightmare. I also hated how it seemed like there were fewer cases and more boxes to unpack. No one has this kind of time.   This might be my last fair with Scholastic. The cost of Scholastic Dollars catalog items has increased substantially and it is cheaper to buy pre-processed, well-bound books with cash from other vendors. The amount of unnecessary hassle and complete lack of respect from my rep and customer support staff made the experience hardly worth my time.
Additional Comments: If fairs don't improve, our district is partnering with another company.

What could we improve: I would like to be able to change my due date.
Additional Comments: I would like to be able to enter & change my due date and not have it set by you.
Thank you for great service.

I feel like I have no control over my account anymore.- but the shipping for the student, and her actual order was fine.

What could we improve: Bring back the $1 books!!!!!!

Our school is choosing to no longer order through your company due to your recent decision to exclude diverse books from some school book fairs (I understand it is up to the school to decide to have the diverse books or not). Even though it is up to the individual school, we feel this decision fuels the hatred and close-mindedness that is destroying our world. Books are great source of Windows and Mirrors. We valued that you carried books with diverse characters to represent students to needed to feel seen, but also for students to learn about other's experience and know that the world is so much bigger than just themselves.
