What could we improve: More classic books to choose from- less movie based books

I did not like that the order was placed on it's own. I did not get the bonus points or the extra books that I could have gotten if it wouldn't have been placed on it's own.  I have always set my own dates on the paper copies and then placed the order the day I said it was due.

Additional Comments: I couldn't believe how fast I got my order--and free shipping is always appreciated!  Great job!  Thank you!

What could we improve: This was our first time ordering in a while and I was not aware that it was all online and you would be submitting my orders for me. I missed out on a bonus because the order was sent out by you. I like the control of submitting my own orders.
Fewer emails
Additional Comments: We have been very pleased with the speed of receiving orders.

What could we improve: My box came damaged. Not Scholastic's fault though.
Additional Comments: I contacted customer service about the damaged book (due to shipping) and they quickly sent out a replacement copy. Thank you!

What could we improve: Make it easier for the children to receive their books directly to their own house instead of shipping to the school. Plus, the the teachers to change the due date for each month the book order is due.
Return to sending monthly flyers, and take away the automatic ordering.  Monthly rewards are also pretty unmotivating.  Miss the free book packs, stickers, etc.  Not as much fun to order anymore.
Additional Comments: I've been doing scholastic orders for our preschool for 15 years, and I miss the old Scholastic!

What could we improve: Make it easier to find types of books (not just search the titles).
Additional Comments: I didn't try to track my package.

What could we improve: Let me know you were placing an online order on my behalf.
Additional Comments: I need more fliers than are being sent.  I updated my class number to 30, but it apparently didn't stick.

What could we improve: Let the teacher decide if the orders are submitted automatically. I would rather submit my orders so I can add mine in before it's processed.
I like to set my own due dates.
Allow us to change the order date
Give teachers back the ability to set due dates
Additional Comments: I didn't even know students made an order until package arrived
Bring back more $1 books

What could we improve: Please go back to the original ordering system where I can set my own due dates monthly ordering. Also, please include the items list on the backs of the order forms so parents can pay with cash or check again. Your new system is not user friendly for educators, and the old system worked much better.
Additional Comments: Our yearly Scholastic Book Fair is coming up soon, and because of your new system where you set the due dates and I cannot, it coincides with our book fair, and I am less likely to get orders because of this. Again, please go back to the old system of sending out monthly flyers and allowing educators to set their own due dates that are convenient for their individual classroom and school schedules.

What could we improve: I miss the old bookclubs for the different levels

Additional Comments: None

What could we improve: It wasn't clear to me when I should enter the orders. I liked when I set my own due date.

I live and teach in an area where there are many students do not have internet, so now that ordering is strictly online and not cash, it is harder.  I am still trying to accommodate my students by having them bring the cash to me, but it is hard because I am having to make change from my personal finances and I usually still end up paying for some of my student's books to make it work.
UPS was trying to deliver on a Saturday and after school hours
I am slowly getting used to the dates that have all ready been set for each order.
I really hate the new assigned due date.  You submitted my student order before I could submit my classroom order.  This robs me of some bonus points and extra rewards I should have gotten.
Additional Comments: Please consider letting teachers set their due date.  OR put it later in the month.  November 12 is WAY too early. The third week would be better!

What could we improve: I have unsubscribed from Scholastic because your new policy about only getting the free books with a $25 order six times a year was very unclear.
Additional Comments: When you change a policy, make sure it's clearly stated on your website.

What could we improve: nothing
A parent ordered online but when I got the package it did not tell me who the parent was and so I have no idea who these books go to.

Additional Comments: I usually get an email saying when a child orders. This time I only got the email after it was shipped.

What could we improve: Organize the books in stacks by student order. Include bags.

The book clubs apparently auto ships now, instead of the teacher submitting the order. So there were still student orders coming in that had to be submitted separately. I lost rewards because of this and chose not to place a teacher order.
I like the new look to the book club flyers. Was not able to change the date for our order.
Allow me to submit my order before the due date you have selected for me.

You used to provide me with the option to send my book order to either my school address or my home address, now it does NOT give me an option.  It just sends to my school address.  While this should not be a problem it is because mail delivery within the school is very slow.  You may have sent my book order in a quick and timely manner but it takes another week or two to get it from our internal mail system.  Please bring back the option to send to home.
I don't like the way credits are used. I should be able to use part of my credit anytime and not have to pay the whole bill.
Additional Comments: Check option should still be available. I have grandparents that want to buy but only want to pay check.

What could we improve: I like being able to set my own due date rather than your new method of you setting it.

Additional Comments: I am surprised at the changes in quality of product (books that come with junk) and the order itself this year seems “thin”

What could we improve: Easier access to the flyers online
Additional Comments: I preferred when I was able to set the due date for my orders

I teach in a low income town.  The new order forms are blocking children access to books.  Many of my families don't have internet or access to ordering on-line.   They also don't have credit cards or checking acct.   When the orders were paper, they could fill them out and send in cash.   It makes me sad that you took this away from them.

What could we improve: You are doing a good job!
I’m finding the selection of books limited
Additional Comments: I have many thoughts about the whole diversity issue. I was researching other options until the decision was reversed. Unimpressed with the pandering.

What could we improve: I had forgotten about this order, so I never selected $10 in books  The order was sent, but no free books, even Scholastic chosen ones, were included.

There was an option on your site that suggested that I call if I need to change the shipping address. When I called, the associates was adamant that the shipping only goes to the school. It shouldn't have that on the site if it's not available. Also, someone may not be there when delivery is made since there are specific hours that the building is not opened. I just happened to be there at our building when our last order arrived. From my understanding, it was the 2nd or 3rd try.  Lisa

Teacher choice has been removed from the ordering process! Teachers are unable to select due dates, charging tax or orders (tax use to be included in the price of the book listec in the flyer), and collect payments from parents or grandparents for ease of ordering for those who do not feel comfortable ordering online. It does not look good when teachers have to take money from family members to place a book order! We teachers are providing a service for Scholastic and the process has been made so much more difficult with less reward and more expensive books.
Additional Comments: It would be nice if there were $1 books for Christmas gifts and student gifts. It sure makes it expensive when teaches have to pay $2+ for books for all students in the class!

What could we improve: Scholastics would offer $1 books and I would order monthly books for my students and parents would build the children's library at home. Books are no longer affordable for me to purchase monthly.  My recent purchase was $2 books :(.
Additional Comments: Bring back the $1 books  please.

What could we improve: Please bring back the $ books.  And give us more to choose from.
Additional Comments: Hoping to bring back more books that are affordable for teachers.

What could we improve: I am disappointed that Scholastic is submitting orders automatically for teachers. Speaking for myself, I choose a specific due date based on when I send home the book order flyers and when I would like to receive the books. I also want to make sure that I am maximizing my bonus points and the value of my order, which cannot be saved in the cart if you want to come back to it later, by the way, so with Scholastic submitting the order without warning is very frustrating! I am also frustrated by the actually flyers that I am sending home. There are hardly any books for students to visibly see on the flyers, with them being mostly toys and trinkets. I'm also disappointed that I cannot seem to find the diversity flyers and Spanish flyers that used to be available.
My parent order was submitted before I was ready to submit. Lost out on maximum rewards from the diminishing reward system
Nothing
It was very confusing trying to use the $10. free when there was no way to put it in. Having to call for a code was time consuming. It all worked out fine, it just took a while.

I am not happy that my student online orders were processed without me going in and finalizing the order. I had items I was going to order with the order but didn't because the order was processed automatically.  I should be the one to finale an order.
Additional Comments: Where are the dollar books?  I have students who have no books in their homes and I have collected donations to buy books each month for them. However, the prices are so high I am unable to do this anymore.

What could we improve: You raised your prices a lot and took out a lot of the things in the teacher store.
Additional Comments: I only had 1 parent order this time, and that has never happened before. I just don't think most parents can afford your prices anymore.

What could we improve: I liked having the opportunity to put my own order in. I also have families that order more having paper catalogs. Children need to see them like they need to read real books.
I don't like the new format where I cannot choose my order dates and due dates with my parents.  I don't like the preset dates.
I would have liked an itemized student orders list in the package. I prefer paper flyers in addition to the online order option

Additional Comments: Thank you for your help.

What could we improve: Let teachers set their own due dates.
The only thing is I don’t like that I can’t set my own due date and then submit it when I want.
Additional Comments: Please let me choose my own due date.

What could we improve: The set ordering date stinks.  I want to be able to set my order due date myself.  An order automatically went through without me even inviting parents to order.

Additional Comments: I didn’t receive any emails when parents ordered online. If my husband hadn’t ordered for our own son, I would have had no clue that other parents had also ordered. In the past I did receive emails when families ordered online.

What could we improve: I strongly dislike the fact that you have made it extremely difficult to place orders for students, from choosing to send only one flyer to the horrible organization when books arrive in trying to figure out what book belongs to who.  But I guess if you save money everyone else has to figure out a way.  Super unfortunate!
I do not like how Scholastic places the orders now and my monthly order forms have changed. Seems to micro managed. I also am annoyed at the reward available.
Additional Comments: Not loving the new system that is in place.

What could we improve: I don't like how you set our due dates for us.
I sent out my flyers to all go out and some orders went through and some are on the next shipment.
Additional Comments: I didn't  receive flyers last year or this year at the beginning of the year. I also did not realize you were only doing online ordering.

What could we improve: Send the next issue so students can see next month book choices.
Additional Comments: I’m. It getting my monthly book pamphlets.

What could we improve: I don't like how you set my dates and that my order automatically goes through. I liked it the old way. the kids (and parents) like the variety of hard copies instead of searching online as well. Not sure I received my bonus coupon points bc it automatically was sent  through.  I know you are probably trying to pace the orders but it's just one more date I have to worry about. Delivery went well.
Additional Comments: See previous comment

What could we improve: I would prefer the monthly book orders. The kids looked forward to their books comping each month. I am disappointed in the new system :(
Additional Comments: Please see the first comment.

What could we improve: The website is not as easy to access as it use to be.  It's also more difficult to browse books.  I feel like it's only taking me to specific titles.  Also, are there no longer $1 and $2 books?  That was such a great way to build our classroom library!

I don’t want my parent order filled for me.  I didn’t know how to change the date on my account.  I have it set up when I send the flyers home to order by a certain date, I want to close out the orders.  Not have it done for me.
I was waiting until a date to order all my orders.  But the company automatically sent my order in and then I was not able to wait until the next cycle and earn free books.
Additional Comments: please DO Not automatically order the books.  WE are usually waiting for all student orders.  You may have a monthly date that works for you, but so do we.  I was just shocked that the new policy is the way it is.

What could we improve: I do not like the ordering process.  In the past you sent various paper order brochures (Kindergarten, Seesaw, 1st grade, etc.) which I sent home to families.  Now there is only one for K/1, one for 2/3 etc.  The current paper brochure has many fewer book selections, but instead includes sections of games to play.  And most importantly, there is NO PAPER ORDER FORM.  You are forcing everyone to only order online, which becomes an equity issue for our families.  Not everyone speaks English well enough or is comfortable enough or even able to order online (perhaps no credit card, etc.).  I offered families the possibility of marking the brochure with their choices and I would place the order on their behalf.  This would mean more work for me, as again there is no longer a paper order form in the brochure.  I called Scholastic and made my concerns known about this and was told that the new ordering process would decrease the work involved for teachers.  That is certainly true if students no longer make any orders on paper.  Sadly, during this last ordering period I only had 3 families order (online), where in the past it was 7-10 (even if it was just one book on a paper order form).    On a different note the books have gotten quite a bit more expensive, with individual paperback book prices increasing by $0.99 to $1.99 which is again financially unobtainable for our families.   If it is Scholastics' goal to support a child's joy of reading and buying their own book, then you have sadly failed.  I am very disappointed in the changes you have made, and ask that you return to the previous paper order form format.
Let the teacher set the automatic submitted date. Because you a tomato ally submitted my order I was unable to use the promo you sent and it led to multiple boxes being sent

I am so very dissappointed that you have raised your prices. Sadly there are no more $1 books, which prices me out of getting a book each month for all of my students. Even at $2 there have only been 2 titles since August at $2. And even though I purchase a TON of books (over $700 worth in August) there is no Dollar Store anymore that opens when I purchase in bulk. Sadly this will be my last year order books and giving each of my students a free book each month as giving all the students in my school a book for their birthdays. I guess we'll have to find an alternative

Additional Comments: The reason I didn't track my order was because I didn't know that I had an order.

What could we improve: As a teacher I would like to adjust or make my own due dates. It is frustrating that current dates can't be changed.
I would like to set the due dates. I usually have orders go home each month with a 2 week due date. This causes parents to not forget and order promptly.
Additional Comments: I think it is more complicated for parents now to do it online.

What could we improve: Go back to the old way
Additional Comments: I dont like the new system..I like the paper orders..I did t even place my personal book order because I like to browse through a paper flyer
Everything's great :)

What could we improve: I think it is silly to charge educators incredible shipping rates.  No codes. The teacher’s own dollars being spent to support their students’ learning and there is no break in shipping?

I am not a fan of the new Scholastic-set order due date.  I prefer to set my own due date so that I can take care of my book orders when it's convenient for me.  I had families place orders on the October flyer with my due date of October 15th.  Unfortunately Scholastic processed those orders on October 11th (their chosen due date) so I have 2 separate boxes arriving at my school.  I have already contacted Scholastic to make my preference known.  Thanks.
nothing

Additional Comments: I wish I would have gotten an email letting me know a student placed an order before the order deadline. I would have added to the order.

What could we improve: My first order was submitted by Scholastic under the new due by date, my second order for the month I submitted a few days later. Not sure why I received the second order first. It was my error in mot understanding that any online orders would be automatically submitted.
I do not like that we as teachers can't change the dates or submit
NA

When I looked up books by grade level from a tab, I didn't get as many options as looking them up under a different place to click for the same grade level. But overall I am always happy with scholastic. The delivery time was quicker than in the past as well :)

Please allow us to select our own due dates.  The automatic submission of orders throws things off as well, where I did not have the opportunity to use my bonus points, etc.  Is there any way to opt out of this?
Additional Comments: Please allow us to select our own due dates again!  The automatic submission of orders throws things off as well, where I did not have the opportunity to use my bonus points, etc.  Is there any way to opt out of this?

The pre-set order date takes away teacher flexibility. (The automatic order placement is helpful).
I do not like that I can no longer put my orders in all together and on my own schedule.
Additional Comments: I do not like the changes you made this school year.  Due to these changes I may not use Scholastic Book Clubs going forwar.

I am disappointed with the prices of the books. The books are very expensive this year. I am also disappointed in the flyers. The games are a waste of space. Offer the kids the chance to see more books. Students don't go online to look for books, they look through the flyers. I only had 2 students order. I'm contemplating not doing any more orders this year. It makes me sad!
Connie Horn

What could we improve: I do not like your new scheduling service. It should be up to the teacher as to when orders will be submitted. The new process is very inconvenient. Also, the new, updated flyers are not good. It seems as if you are promoting toys, gadgets, and accessories instead of books!
It would be great to have paper order forms for the students.  I have lots of students who don't use computers so my students are limited in what they can order.
Additional Comments: I would appreciate it if not computer using students would be able to order as easily as others. I do not like the new process of ordering.

What could we improve: It took so long for the books arrive.  Speed up the process.

I honestly do not like the "new" scholastic. I find it frustrating from beginning to end. I have ordered extensively for the last 29 years sending the bookorder out almost every month. I am not sure that I will order again this year.
it's getting expensive

Several families were disappointed about no longer having the option to order with the paper form. They wound up not ordering anything.   In the box we received, all the books were mixed together and the packing slip was not very clear. It would be helpful to have the books divided by student/recipient, even if just on the packing list.
I had no families order
Let me order books with points without paying shipping
I do not like the new ordering process or the new flyers
Additional Comments: Last year the students really enjoyed looking through the flyers and picking out what they wanted to purchase when they got home to show their parents. The new flyer is not as nice and does not have as many choices as the old one on it. Also, the new ordering is very confusing for the teacher. I like to set my own date for the orders to be due and send it in, when it's convenient to me. My last order went in without me even knowing it, and I was unable to order my teacher items. I really dislike the new system and I feel like I get less orders from my class because they are unable to browse through the flyer like they did last year.

What could we improve: Everything if fine
Please do not auto-submit my orders for me. I prefer to do it myself as I have done for many years. Is there a way to turn off that feature?
Digital code sent right away
Additional Comments: Again....it seems like I have to call customer service to get my digital access code every year.

What could we improve: Fewer parents are ordering. Not sure if it is due to cost or inability to order online.
I don’t love the new policy of YOU placing my order and shipping it. I might have had some paper orders in the classroom.
Not sure
Go back to the $1 books for teachers!!!
Additional Comments: Let teachers set the due date!!!!!

What could we improve: Please get rid of the automatic order placement or give teachers the option to opt out.
I liked when each month had a separate rewards date, such as this last month was from 8/1 to 10/19. I did not pay attention with multiple orders, a little disappointing.
Quicker delivery

Additional Comments: Very Happy with Service

What could we improve: I do not like that Scholastic automatically process my student's orders.  They do not give enough time between when I receive the catalogs and when my due date is set.
Additional Comments: Please bring back more weekly book specials so that teachers can purchase books for their students.  Having only 1 $2 book to choose from does not give every grade level a selection each week.
This is my first time using Scholastic since I taught 30+ years ago. If I would've know it was this easy, I would've started as soon as I got back into teaching!

What could we improve: The new process is a bit confusing - I see that it's more streamlined, but seems inflexible for setting deadlines and receiving notifications.

I do not like when Scholastic automatically submits orders. I had set a deadline for my families for the end of the month and Scholastic submitted an order early, before I had more orders come in, so I miss out on those accumulated bonus points.
Additional Comments: Again, please stop automatically submitting orders that have been placed. I set deadlines for my families, and would appreciate being able to submit orders myself when ready. Thank you.

What could we improve: All online ordering does not give families to send cash/check, I believe. I missed the opportunity to include my teacher order, that seemed to be a different process as well. It will take time to get used to the changes.

I was not aware that the orders would be automatically submitted. I knew there were a few changes this year, but missed that one. I usually place my order for the classroom right before I submit the class orders, depending on the rewards I have earned.

Additional Comments: If you can note on the shipping label that deliveries must be made Mondays-Fridays, that would be helpful.  A couple of times the delivery was attempted on a weekend, then when checking the status it said it was available for me to pick up at post office.  Days later it was redelivered to school.

What could we improve: My order was sent as 2 orders, since you set a different date then I did.  Now I don't get full credit for bonus points ?  This new system is not the best.
Additional Comments: Please allow us to set the dates the book club is due

What could we improve: When wanting to buy with points, you have to really hunt to actually find the correct page

I am not a fan of the new ordering with families ordering online. I had sent  home fliers and had some parents order online. However, the system just pushed the order through so now I have 3 separate orders for 3 students. I lost out on some of the incentives for the overall amount spent. I personally liked the way it used to be for ordering, it was easier on families as well.
There are changes this year such as the paper flyers not having the orders on them, setting a due date for the class and fewer bonus features that have taken away the previous positive experience.
Additional Comments: Please return to the way orders used to be. Many colleagues aren’t pleased and will not use Scholastic.

What could we improve: Having the deadline set for my class order seemed strange. I wasn't sure if I could change it, though I wanted to. It is so diffferent not having monthly orders. This year is an adjustment for sure.

Additional Comments: Hate that it’s all online now… I work at a Title 1 school and most don’t have access to the internet and would prefer to pay cash or check.

What could we improve: I never saw the student orders.  They were sent out without my knowledge.
Additional Comments: I couldn't tell how many bonus points I received from student orders.  I had no "free" book choices.  Please keep all orders together until the last day of ordering.  I cannot keep track of individual orders being sent out separately. NOT HAPPY WITH THIS NEW ARRANGEMENT!

What could we improve: One of the books I ordered for a student arrived with a bent book cover.
I do not like the automatically submitting orders on the due date.  I also am not a fan that we cannot choose our own due date for students
Books took a little longer to arrive then I anticipated

Better selection at better prices. Many favorites from years past are no longer available from Scholastic. I have MANY students who are unable to order online, for whatever reason. Adding tax to my teacher order is not okay, either.

The new ordering system of only the online option made it more difficult for my student’s families to order. The population of my student’s families are not literate and don’t have computer access. I ending up still collecting the cash and ordering it under teacher orders. Now it doesn’t track who ordered what and I had to annually keep track of it myself whereas in the past the computer gave me info about who ordered what.
Additional Comments: I would like another option for parents that can’t order online. One family told me she couldn’t find my name online when trying to order online so they ended up not ordering at all.

What could we improve: I wish that you went back to having more traditional classic books.   Nothing thrilled with the quality of the writing offered .
Additional Comments: Please provide better quality books, the topics and lack of good writing keeps us from ordering books from you often.  The books are poorly written and not changing.  A third grader can be reading chapter books, not just graphic novels.
I trust Scholastic Book Club for their ease and service.

What could we improve: I was unable to use coupons because the order was automatically submitted before I reviewed and submitted myself. I do not like the new system for ordering.

Inexpensive, poor quality books are being sold for outrageous prices this year.  Scholastic Book Clubs is no longer an affordable option for building home libraries..  The changes have been terrible and I will no longer support this company as it seems to be based on greed.
It would be helpful if you have a note or a letter to send home with exactly how to order so our classroom gets credit.  Do you have something like this available?

What could we improve: Go back to the way scholastic used to be.
Additional Comments: You are going to need to have more book selections, or parents are not going to order. Also, teachers should choose the due dates. Go back to the way scholastic used to be.

What could we improve: Ship more quickly
More user friendly website
I want to be able to choose my order due date again. I also feel that I didn't have as many orders because the kids didn't have the flyers to look at to choose books.
Additional Comments: I know prices with everything have increased, but your prices have really increased.  I 've always been able to encourage parents to order because they could get quality children's books at great prices, but with the price increase, it's much more difficult.

What could we improve: Some guardians do not use the online systems.  I am seeing less books ordered now that there is no other option.
Allowing us to select our own due dates.

Send the books.

What could we improve: I'm disappointed that the dollar book deals have gone away.  I live in a rural area with lots of families struggling to make ends meet. I get it...everything has gone up in price but please give us some books that we are able to gift our students.

Better ordering system, a reward system,

I wish, as a teacher, I could enter orders for my students.  They can still give me the cash, and I can use my card for the order.  Please consider this.

I wasn't aware my order would automatically be placed and I lost out on all my rewards.
I preferred when teachers were allowed to enter student orders, not all parents are comfortable with online ordering, many lack the language skills to do so.
I always enjoyed setting my own due date/ order submission
I feel like there are not as many books to choose from.  Also, I miss the $1 book each month.

You made changes to ordering such as making my due date and not letting me change this.  What if that is not the date I want?  I do not get to change it to suit the needs of parents and students.  I understand you want them to go online, but you do not give me the autonomy to choose for myself anymore.
Not set parent orders to automatically submit and allow me to set me due dates

Kids can no longer send in money with their book order. It seems that is all has to be done online. This is limiting to some of my students whose parents don’t have access to either a computer or the credit card to purchase the items. Please go back to the older format of students being able to send in their order for me to input.

I am very unhappy with the removal of the Student Order forms. Now the only way for families to order books is online and many students in socio economically disadvantaged families do not have access to the internet. Many families will no longer order from the scholastic book order if they cannot just send their student to school with cash. Almost 100% of the scholastic book orders that my school receives from students are through cash and not the online order option. Many students also save up their allowance and birthday money to use to purchase books. None of this is accessible to children without allowing them to submit an order to the teacher. Please consider bringing the student order forms back as to not further disadvantage students with different access opportunities. As of now, I am having to pay tax on my students orders just to provide them with access to scholastic books which is very unfair to an already underpaid profession.
Additional Comments: Please consider my request.

What could we improve: My families are not happy with the o line order only
Additional Comments: It would be best for our parents if they could still order by check

What could we improve: Allow teachers to select order date
The teacher should be able to create the due date and submit them like they have in the past.
Bring back weekly $1 books
Additional Comments: Bring back $1 books for the week!

What could we improve: First order from family submitted automatically so it didn’t count in the larger order I submitted myself.
Using the rewards can be explained better.

Additional Comments: Love Scholastic.  Easy to order, fast delivery.

What could we improve: I don’t love having due dates selected for me. I also think you are missing a certain demographic by not allowing me to collect and send orders from students who want to pay cash.
Turn around time could be a little faster.
Cheaper book options. Need $1.00 books back
Include the bill like you used to.
Offer 10,000 bonus points in September
The emails I received about parent orders had General titles. Could you make the title “parent online order” for urgency. I get lots emails.
I prefer to set my own due date and to finalize my order for submission. Because it was done automatically, I did not order anything and I would have.
Additional Comments: Seems like there are fewer paper flyers. Too bad, as those were what got kids excited to ask their parents to order

What could we improve: The order was submitted automatically so I never had a chance to use points or get free books. I don’t understand why scholastic now won’t let the teachers submit or change the due date. Makes no sense.
Additional Comments: Let teacher change the due date and get rid of the order being automatically submitted

What could we improve: Nothing

Additional Comments: I haven’t looked this month but I hope Scholastic will continue with the Judy Newman dollar books each month and not raise the price. I appreciate that deal as an opportunity to get literature circle books for student groups… and I’d love if it could be a graphic novel or fun fiction book for older (middle school) readers.

What could we improve: I HATE the auto order feature that’s been implemented. The due dates don’t meet our class needs
Additional Comments: We should be able to set our own due dates or choose not to participate in the auto ordering.

What could we improve: I think the quality of the books has gone way down in the last few years. The books are very materialistic and there are too many that are "marketing" material and not good quality. Our teachers don't like the new online format, and the families feel that they could just go to Amazon and order a book. The prices are too high, as well. Why is Scholastic so different?
Additional Comments: Please go back to paper copies and better quality choices at good prices!

What could we improve: I prefer allowing book orders to be given out physically.   Also, I like the ability to collect orders with money.

Offer more seasonal books... ones about scarecrows, pumpkins, fall.  Also books by more popular authors like Todd Parr, Lois Ehlert, Aaron Reynolds, Kevin Henkes, to name a few.  Also... Curious George books!  :)
Additional Comments: I do not like how Scholastic sets the due date this year, and automatically pushes through orders by a certain date.  I like to choose a date that works well with things happening in our school community so parents have enough time to place their order.  I also like to add things to my class order, and if the order has been pushed through, then I will have to pay extra in taxes and shipping.  I will not be placing my own order when that happens.

What could we improve: Let me set my own due date
Additional Comments: Let me set my own due date
Although we are encouraging parents to order online I am still offering to do the order for parents.  Does no one else still need the order form that was on the back of the flyers?

What could we improve: Disappointed about the shipping speed. One order was placed only hours after the other order but took an extra week to come in
Parents have expressed wanting the flyers like before. The kids like looking through them to choose their books every month

You pushed the order through. Not me. I’ve looked to see if I have some setting switched I didn’t find one b/c my September order sat until I pushed it through. So since it was pushed through, the books I wanted to get using my points didn’t “qualify” for free shipping. And I earned some free books last time and that somehow disappeared this time. I also miss $1 books. Teachers are the ones buying the books and we can’t afford it anymore. Oh well, it is what it is.
Not place orders on your due date… go back to teachers assigning. I missed a reward due to this.
I prefer the old method of ordering when I could enter orders for kids
Bring back books for under $2.
I do not like the new process. Parents ordering whenever they want makes money for you and makes more work for me. I feel as though I am working for you.
Additional Comments: Your book selection needs to have more classic books. You have far too many book selections that are poor  quality.

What could we improve: More rewards for kids as in the past
I had a lot fewer students order than ever before. I believe most students didnt go online to look at the flyers.
Additional Comments: My students preferred the flyers that went home where they could shop while looking at an actual paper.  I didn't like not being able to set my own due date. There was too much time between sending the notice and the due date.

What could we improve: Free shipping would be great!
Please bring back the $1 books so teachers can buy more books as gifts for students.   Some people don’t feel comfortable asking for donations for their class.
Parents are upset that they have to order online.  The flyer is not liked by parents.
Additional Comments: Not happy with all new changes this year.  Parents have made comments about it also.  I anticipate less orders this year.

What could we improve: I guess I did not read that parent orders will be automatically sent by a date Scholastic determined. I was caught off guard.

Please don’t set our due dates and please make it easier to change the teacher on the orders from month to month. Some of us co teach and often parents send orders to both teachers and we can’t combine to get our rewards we deserve.
Additional Comments: It’s also hard to go look at books you want when issued a reward and then get back to the order.
Not liking the automatic order submission

What could we improve: The online order did not allow me to change the delivery address.  I wanted the delivery to be at my home instead of my school site because we have some holidays (no school) in November 2023, and I  wanted to be sure that the delivery was not placed at the front of the school and left there for a few days.  Previously, I had a delivery to my school site after the school office had closed at 4:00 pm.  It was left to the side of the front door of the school and the office staff did not notice it.  I found it when we returned to school on Monday.  If the delivery is going to a school site, then it should try to be delivered when the school office is open, so the package is not sitting outside over the weekend.  Thank you.
Additional Comments: I would like to have information books about the CA Gold Rush for 2nd to 4th grade readers.

What could we improve: I liked the older printout where we could cut squares out with students’ name and order on them.  It was easy to tape/tuck into their order.
Better flyers.  Giving the options for parents to Order with cash.
Additional Comments: I do not like the changes you have made this year.

What could we improve: Have a better way to input the emails of the parents; and have a better way to send out an email to remind them of the book order.
I would have liked to close my order myself rather than you doing it for me
Additional Comments: Is there a way to take back a little more control over when the orders get submitted so I have time to submit what I want in my teacher order? I did not have a chance to place my order before my parents' orders went out.

What could we improve: I don't like the 'new' way!!!! I set a due date and then the orders just get processed when they come to you.
I have parents that cannot order online.   I would like the option of parents sending a check or money, so that I can place their orders.
Additional Comments: Please bring back the option of parents being able to order with the order form.  Not all parents are able to order online.

What could we improve: I miss the $2 books in the orders and the $1 book deals as well
the flyers are late.  I received the october flyers late.  I have not received the november flyers and the order due date is set for November.  It is confusing for the parents.
Additional Comments: There are not enough books in the flyer and the prices are not affordable.

What could we improve: You could put diverse books into each and every Scholastic Book fair bookcase and NOT BOW to public pressure from intolerant a-holes! Help us make a better future by raising tolerant and kind children, your books MATTER!!!
Additional Comments: Stand up for what is right! Educate the future to be better than we are now!!!! HAVE DIVERSITY IN YOUR BOOKFAIRS! -all teachers, everywhere

What could we improve: No
I do not like the chosen deadlines. They confuse parents and do not arrange delivery of Holiday themed items before the holiday arrives.
Additional Comments: I feel like the catalogues are pushing junky pens and slime rather than books.
Great experience and the students were happy.

What could we improve: Send a reminder of the due date for orders.  This is all new this year and I didn't get my order in.
Additional Comments: I am not to happy with the selection of books for orders for the kindergarten grade level.  There are too many toys and other items on the flyer.  There used to be a wider variety of books especially at specific reading levels that I was able to suggest to parents.  Overall I have not been happy with the changes.

What could we improve: I just don't know why the order has to come through me?  I feel like time is wasted for me to notice and respond.
I cannot figure out how to use my ten dollar free book coupon when I was ordering online.

All communities don’t like online ordering and would prefer to pay in cash. To have to call in and place individual student orders that must now also include tax, is taking us back 20 years and, honestly, ridiculous. There needs to be two viable options and not just require all transactions happen online for families.
Shipping took a long time
Additional Comments: Shipping took exactly 10 days which is a long time in my opinion. I haven’t ordered in a while and I probably won’t again.

What could we improve: I didn’t like that the books were automatically shipped.  I like having control over when to conclude the online orders.
Allow teachers to create their own book order due dates like before.   I'm still confused by the new guidelines...very confusing.
Additional Comments: The print out of the total book orders included with the book box has print that is too small.  I include the slip of what each parent ordered when I send the books home with students, and the print is so tiny, it's hard to read.  Can you please just make things back to how they used to be?

What could we improve: Nothing at this time
Faster shipping More book options Some items (like little journal keychains or pencil sharpeners) are not very clear that there will only be one item instead of more than one

Additional Comments: I was sad I didn’t get a reminder before shipment. I wanted to order teacher books and use a coupon code.

What could we improve: I don't like all the new changes.
Additional Comments: Still don't like all the new changes.

What could we improve: I need flyers to hand out to my students, they get excited about what you have to offer with the flyers.  I also need to be able to set my own due dates.  We have things going on at our school that I know interfere and I need to be able to work around them.
Additional Comments: Can't you send the flyers out for the next month in our previous months order?

What could we improve: I don't like having the set teacher due date.  It is too late in the month to receive holiday books.  I prefer to set my own, but I think it is confusing when I say one thing and the website says something different.
Bring back the student order entery option. I have families who prefer paying the school teacher for the order

Additional Comments: I love the ease for parents and teachers to order books to encourage students to read! The options for delivery are awesome too!

What could we improve: I do not like that you cannot set the order date for customers. This is very limiting.
Additional Comments: I like the new catalogs but dislike the new book club set up

What could we improve: Setting the due dates for my class.
Additional Comments: You ahould go back to allowing teacher to set their own due dates.

What could we improve: The catalogs need to bring back more affordable books! The $1 and $2 book selections have all but disappeared. Even the 6-packs for $6, etc. Books in these price ranges make a big difference to young families, new teachers, and families who have fallen on hard times.
Additional Comments: I am disappointed to see the changes in the catalogs! There are less affordable books for families and teachers. Please bring back these options in future catalogs and in future "online only" selections.

What could we improve: Nothing

I don’t like the automatic order submission. I’d rather be able to choose my own due date according to our school calendar. I’ve had parents message me and say they’d forgotten to order, have I sent it in yet? I can wait an extra day to get theirs but with the auto order, I’ve lost that option. It’s also confusing when I get an email saying I can place a teacher order as long as it’s before the next due date but I went in and tried to do that, I couldn't. Also why am I getting the October issue catalogs to go out for November due date?
Additional Comments: Please send the correct number of catalogs. I was short the preschool by a few but way over on the k-1 flyer.

What could we improve: Let me choose order date like I could in past
I wish my order had not been auto submitted! I had things I wanted to add, but life interfered, the auto deadline popped up. I wish the auto order fill could be turned on or off
I preferred having parents turn in order slips with payment and me calling in the order. I feel less parents order due to needing to do it on line.
none
Additional Comments: thanks

What could we improve: I have not received my book box yet. It was supposed to be here on Wednesday. Very disappointed!
I want the order forms back on the sheets we send how.  I have parents who won’t order without
Nothing. It’s so much easier now with the changes
It would be nice to have a slip to say who ordered the online orders.  I received a box, but didn't know who ordered.
Additional Comments: The only reason I did not track was because I did not know someone ordered.

What could we improve: I don’t like the set date for ordering.  Also, some families do not like to order online.  They liked sending in a check or cash to me for their order.  My first order of the school year is usually big, but this year I only had two students order.

I don't like that I cannot enter student orders myself. It creates a problem when I have to include a student's order with my class order (extra taxes, separating my money from theirs, keeping track of who ordered what etc.). I also am frustrated that my class spent over $500 and we only got 2 free books. You don't even give coupons to use  on the next order. Please change it back to the way it was. Also, where are the flyers to hand out?
You keep sending me 18 flyers when I have 23 students. I have been calling for years, and I don't have time to call anymore.
Additional Comments: Send me enough catalogs for my entire class... parents are getting frustrated and if will affect your sales.

What could we improve: I'd like to set my own order due date.
I don't like how due dates are now set for us. I would like to be able to set my own.
I’m having a difficult time finding book lots for a good price to use my points on. We use them for birthday presents for our students. This school year I haven’t been able to find any.
Not automatically submitted parent orders. I had other parents order later, and because my order was previously submitted, I received less bonus points.

I never received any notice the way orders are done now changing from last year.  Plus, the prices have increased (like everything else) and there are not many less expensive ones I purchase for my kiddos.

It would be nice for you to have the book of the week back. Many teachers across the US have sponsored classrooms, so every child can get books in their hands. Raising the prices and not continuing the $1 books is very upsetting. It makes it harder for us to get books in kiddos hands.
Additional Comments: Please bring back the dollar books. This helps us teachers put books in kids hands! Which should be the overall goal with the partnership between teachers/schools and scholastic.

What could we improve: I didn't know parents ordered, maybe an email when parents order instead of just the shipping email

Additional Comments: The parents miss having the paper orders they submit to the school. Not everyone has internet access to submit an order.
Please bring back classics like very hungry caterpillar and good night moon

What could we improve: None
I do not like to give out all of the parents' email addresses. Is there another way to give information?
Need order forms sooner
Allowed teachers to select their own due date
allow me to set the due date rather than having a preset due date for books
Additional Comments: Please allow the teacher to set the due date again.

What could we improve: Send me the correct grade level flyers, attached to my name.  I keep getting the 3rd grade ones, not the 5th grade ones.  I have never changed grade levels.
Additional Comments: I am still not receiving the correct flyers for fifth grade.

What could we improve: The dollar store is gone and the weekly dollar book no longer exists.
Additional Comments: The dollar book store unlocking when we placed an order was an amazing plus of Scholastic. With it being gone, I can no longer buy books for my entire class.

What could we improve: I do not like the automatic close out of parent orders.  Also the high prices of books will not allow me to purchase books for my 26 first graders.  It is not affordable.
Give us back the $1 books, even if we only have access to them after spending a certain amount.
Additional Comments: Bring back the $1 books please. Or class sets of the same book for a good price

What could we improve: I do not like that you pick the times my order is submitted and then submit automatically
Additional Comments: Yes- give the presenting options back to me. I don't like the scheduled times I am able to order. I was able to order monthly but you have made that difficult by submitting my orders when you want. I like the old model of ordering better!

What could we improve: The auto ordering messed me up a bit...have never had that happen since I have been with scholastic which is the last 10+ years .

I liked how you offered parents the option to order through the teachers last school year.  Since everything went entirely online this year, I know I will have a lot fewer orders.  I don't like how the due dates are automatically set for us and we can't change it.
Additional Comments: I hope your flyers will look like how it did back then.  I hope you change everything back to how it was.

What could we improve: I do not like the mandatory submit date.  We have to work around fall break ( charter school) and I almost didn’t have enough points to get Christmas books for my kids, all 28 of them.
Additional Comments: I’m considering less orders per year. After 16 years this seems like more of a hassle.  I hope to get more books in the hands  of my students if I can figure this out.   The deadlines haven’t matched with our breaks and at a convenient time for me to submit my order.

What could we improve: Give teachers back the technology in the bonus catalogue and the freedom to choose the dates.
Additional Comments: Definitely dissatisfied with the changes in the early offers- taking away 10,000 bonus points and technology

What could we improve: I only served based on an email I had received about $10 in my account that would be automatically applied.  It didn’t happen.

Additional Comments: I have always enjoyed providing Scholastic book orders to my students. I was disheartening to see the controversy over providing diverse titles at your Book Fairs and had considered stopping my use of your company. I was glad to see the reversal of that decision. However, my colleagues and I are keeping watch on what is provided and I will cease support if it seems that diverse literature is being limited.

What could we improve: Bring back affordable books. $1 specials in particular. And books that families can afford. The new pricing isn’t affordable like it used to be. The big incentive was that scholastic book club books were considerably less expensive than amazon or a book store. And as a teacher I miss the $1 books I would purchase as gifts for my students.

Additional Comments: Great service

What could we improve: I wish teachers had more $1 choices to choose from, rather than rewards/perks unlocking after a certain amount.
The teacher point usage and spending is not very user-friendly.  It also doesn’t seem consistent—I was sent an email saying I had over 2,000 points, but when I login I only see ~1100.
I want to be able to set my own due dates
I don’t like that dates are set for orders
Teachers should get free shipping when sent to school
Additional Comments: Free teacher shipping when riding books without a student order
There used to be more bargain books that my students could afford. The prices seem to be higher and so I have less kids order now. Would it possible to have a few more $1 or $2 books added?

What could we improve: Nothing
Additional Comments: As a teacher, I appreciate all the bonuses for free books. I’ve created a really great library for my students.

What could we improve: better deals
The new catalogs should have a place to write the class code and due date.
I think you are doing great!  I love the notifications of boxes being shipped, arrival dates, and when my box has been delivered!!  Keep up the great work!!
Additional Comments: Extremely happy with your communication and notifications!  I love how orders include a print out with students’ names and orders!  Thank you!
Unfortunately many of my families do not have the money to buy books for their children at the prices offered. Wish there was more $1.00 and $2.00 books.

What could we improve: Parents should be able to send in paper orders as they have in the past! This is a pain!!! I have families without internet…
Not a fan of the catalog with prices off to side.

What could we improve: Let me know my books arrived

Additional Comments: I have always had a positive experience with Scholastic!

What could we improve: There was no section online to input student flyer orders.
Additional Comments: Please bring back the section to input student flyer orders.

What could we improve: Find a way not to charge so much tax.  I don't understand why, as a school entity, we are even paying tax.

Scholastic is the best!

What could we improve: Send physical catalogs
Additional Comments: Are you still sending physical catalogs? We did not receive any, and I feel that people are more likely to purchase online if the kids can look through the catalogs first.

What could we improve: I do not like having the due dates pre set for me. I hadn't had a chance to hand out our book orders. I had created my own due date ...this made my order only 1 book.

What could we improve: I Do Not like that you now automatically submit an order. I do have my that in my settings and I want to submit when I want to so I can order books too.  Very disappointing.
Additional Comments: DO NOT automatically submit orders for teachers who do not want that!!!

What could we improve: I do not like the new digital ordering in the book flyers. I wish there were still a place to write our class code.

I would like to be able to set my own due dates.  I did submit our class order before the due date, but I don't know if the families see the default date when they are online.   Why did the dollar amounts change back?  I thought the everything as even dollars was great, and now you have gone back to the random amounts.
Need dollar books back and better prices-way too expensive to buy my students books

I got another email with the same $10 off this month and I hope it works because I did not get any free books in my last order because the $10 were suppose to be off but it never happened.

What could we improve: Choices and prices in flyer
Additional Comments: More selection and more low price and diverse books

What could we improve: Online orders are difficult for some low income families

Additional Comments: I have used Scholastic for a few years now, and this year I see a HUGE improvement in shipping time for the book orders compared to the last 2 years. I love having this option conveniently available for myself and my students.

What could we improve: I prefer being able to choose my own close date. I do not like Scholastic picking a random date for me. The date assigned is arbitrary and hard to remember. Will you please go back to letting teachers decide the closing date? Thank you!
I don’t like how the order form is set up. I like the old way better.
Additional Comments: I am very confused with the site and seeing what my students have purchased. A little difficult navigating your site. I will try again but it needs to be easier.
I don’t like the new fliers, an  SC the bonus catalog is a joke. Barely anything I want.

I preferred when I could set my own date and I miss the 10,000 point September bonus.

What could we improve: Allow us to change the due dates like in the past.
Additional Comments: It would be great if families had the option to pay in class as well as online.

What could we improve: I do not like the new system where parents have to order online and I cn not set the due date.  I think I lost a lot of potential orders due to the change.
Improve prices, bring back dollar books and higher teacher points per order

I hate the new flyers. My parents don't all use that technology and definitely most won't login to a website. Most prefer cash or check orders that I submit. I don't get flyers with my orders...I'd rather get them that way.
More $1 or $2 choices to gift books to students.

I am currently boycotting Scholastic for your decision to put BIPOC and LGBTQ+ books at book fairs in an opt-in category. Our school is invested in doing the overdue work of anti-racism and anti-bias teaching & learning. So as a leader in my school I am leading the charge to divest of your company as you are harmfully excluding (again) our BIPOC and LGBTQ+ authors, students, and community members. Moreover you are using your power to erase the REAL diverse experiences and complexity of the world. In doing so you uphold the harmful and oppressive idea that only white heteronormative Christian experiences are valued and worthy of the freedom to exist w/o conditions. I hope you repair this situation soon. There is always repair and redemption despite the harm you have already caused.
Additional Comments: Revisit your interview questions so that you have more BIPOC and LGBTQ+ folx in high level policy and power places within your company.
Bonus points were much less than typical back to school order.

What could we improve: The fliers this year aren’t very appealing. They are limited on the number of products shown and seem to be promoting more toys than books.
Additional Comments: I wish the fliers were more like those of years past. They are too cluttered with toys and not as informative with the book levels, descriptions, and more books listed might mean more orders.

What could we improve: Go back to how you use to run the book orders please!! Monthly was so much better, as well as teachers setting their own due dates
Teachers in my building don't like the new setup of families ordering online only, not being able to set your own due date, and no more 1 dollar books.

I’m disappointed in the changes scholastic has made. Less parents want to order online and the locked due date isn’t cool ….so many of our teachers want more choices for 1-2 dollar books because that’s out of our pockets and we already buy so much. I know why things were structured this way but many teachers are considering not participating with scholastic very much longer if this continues,
Additional Comments: Please listen to your customers and make some changes back to your old way of doing things

What could we improve: It would be nice for teachers to get free shipping all the time.
Additional Comments: I would like to have free shipping for teachers at any time.
I jave switched grade levels im teachinf, can we get books for 1st grade?

What could we improve: The new flyers and way of ordering is not customer friendly. My students need the option of filling in the paper order and bringing a check or cash into the classroom.
Additional Comments: Please make paper order forms available again.

What could we improve: Make the website easier to navigate when you are a teacher entering student orders.

I dont like the automated shipping. Its stressful to make sure codes are put in before it automatically ships. Disappointed to hear about the segregated books at the book fair to appease some people without doing the right thing and losing book sales for those authors. Sad there isnt a Target gift card offered anymore with points that was used for school purchases.

Go back to how you use to be. Flyers monthly and let us as teachers place orders when we want to. I normally have tons of orders monthly…this year I’ve only have two. It’s so sad and disappointing. PLEASE go back to MONTHLY FLYERS. You will get more business. I’m in teachers groups and so many have already stopped using you and are asking where else they can order books from. Just go back to the way it use to be. PLEASE

Go back to the old flyers! All this new stuff is horrible. Why would you combine two different flyers into one and then put less books in them?? No one needs a list to write on. Your website also is not user friendly, so if you're trying to drive traffic to your site by putting less books in your book flyers, it's not a good decision. And what's with the price hike? Where are my two dollar books? Why do I get $10 free with a qualifying order, but the only books I can get are $9.99? So there are less books to choose from and what is available is now overpriced. What could we improve: I will no longer purchase books for my students. They will purchase on-line but that will mean that you will be selling less books since many parents in our demographic area don't have on-line access.  I was also very disappointed by the added tax after placing my order. I am also very disappointed that my accumulated points are no longer redeemable for gift cards. I have accumulated nearly 24,000 points. I will also say that my fellow colleagues (teachers) are also disappointed and will no longer purchase Scholastic books. Very disappointing!

I was not happy to see the cheapest book costing $2. I purposely planned my campaign with books being $1-$1.50 and now I'll have to cut out some of the books each student gets to compensate for the higher cost. I don't have an issue with the higher cost, I just wish I knew about it so I could have planned better.
Faster delivery please. Thank you
Allow teachers to set their own due date and manage when orders are submitted

Additional Comments: Offer more teacher resource books to be used with Bonus points.

What could we improve: My only complaint is the shipping cost to schools for the books if it doesn't hit $25.  I work in a very rural, low SES school in West Virginia.  Some of those kids can only afford one book and it doesn't always hit the $25 marker for shipping.  Then I either have to pay it (on top of the other many things I pay for my classroom) or I have to send the book orders back and tell them I can't order if it's just one student.  I understand shipping isn't cheap, but can those low orders just be piggy-backed onto another order that goes out to that same location (if possible)?  I'm not sure what the answer is.  I just hate seeing kids that really want more books (and can't afford much) suffer sometimes.  Thanks for all you do!  We do appreciate how affordable you all try to make these books for teachers and students alike!
Return to your "old" system of flyers and due dates.
Additional Comments: I am disappointed in the smaller number of (non-book) options available for "purchase" with bonus points.

What could we improve: offer books that are more reasonably priced....too high...kids aren't ordering!
Since the order was submitted by Scholastic and not me, I lost out on the opportunity to redeem points and $10 to spend towards books for my class.

Additional Comments: The only thing I'd like to mention is that I"m not a fan of the random due dates.  For classroom management purposes, it's so much easier to be able to set my own due date.  It's easier for the parents as well if they know book orders are always due at the end of the month, which was when I would always set my due date.

What could we improve: Lower prices

I noticed this was not taking place this year and I’ve had to find other ways to continue this project since that is not available. I am disappointed this isn’t a special anymore because it was so cost efficient as an educator to provide my students with books.
The name of student on order form was first name only. I happened to have 2 of the same name.

It is incredibly disappointing.
